definition: to strongly defend one's position/to be entrenched/to cling to
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: Many people still cling to the old customs and beliefs.
sentences.chinese: 许多人仍然固守旧习惯和信仰。

sentences.english: So the contract concerning thirdparty came into existence with the need of reality.
sentences.chinese: 固守合同相对性将带来严重的实质不平等。

sentences.english: Joining the euro meant that countries could carry on with old habits for longer.
sentences.chinese: 加入欧元意味著这些国家可以继续固守旧习。

sentences.english: Holding the mystery of the faith in a pure conscience.
sentences.chinese: 要存清洁的良心，固守真道的奥秘。

sentences.english: Pure literature in this era of almost no way out, still cling to.
sentences.chinese: 在这个纯文学几乎已经走投无路的年代，仍然固守。

sentences.english: Zhao Yang with a high stick to the city deep pool, so that's difficult to succeed Moses.
sentences.chinese: 赵凭借晋阳高城深池固守，使智氏难以得手。

sentences.english: He tries to protect his pure sky from being polluted by evil and falsity .
sentences.chinese: 他固守那份纯净的天空，不让邪恶和虚伪轻易污染。

sentences.english: However, Gretchen was just a young populace-girl who had sticked to the traditional, feudalist and old moral concepts.
sentences.chinese: 然而，格蕾欣却是固守封建传统道德规范的平民少女。

sentences.english: You may find that you do not need softeners or static cling removers.
sentences.chinese: 你会发现你并不需要柔软剂或静态固守有些压抑。

sentences.english: We persevered in the numb economical and political system.
sentences.chinese: 我们固守僵化的经济和政治体制。

sentences.english: A solemn pagoda is keeping guard for the desolate plateau.
sentences.chinese: 庄严的佛塔，固守着这片苍凉的高原。

sentences.english: We were told to hold on in the position.
sentences.chinese: 我们接到命令要固守阵地。

sentences.english: On living a poor but clean life I insist.
Yet policymakers in Tokyo still cling to this model today.
sentences.chinese: 然而东京的决策者们至今仍然固守这一模式。

sentences.english: Domestically too we have to open wider, invigorate the economy and not be restricted by conventional thinking.
sentences.chinese: 对内也要开放搞活，不要固守一成不变的框框。

sentences.english: He had been entrenched at the Abidjan residence with a band of loyal fighters.
sentences.chinese: 他和一伙效忠他的军人在阿比让的住所固守。

definition: to defend one's property to the death/to cling obstinately to old habits/die-hard
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
to stand a siege/trapped in a besieged city
to rely on natural barriers (for one's defense)
(to resist the enemy) relying on inaccessible territory
to give up defending/to yield/to surrender
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
to cache/to hide supplies (from the enemy)
to fortify defenses and raze the fields (idiom); to leave nothing for the invader/scorched earth policy
